intro: Dubyaea muliensis, commonly known as the Mulien dubyaea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dubyaea muliensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
